newsitem.title: USA: Canadian spot natgas slips ahead of milder weather.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot natgas slips ahead of milder weather.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices were mostly lower Thursday as forecasts called for a return of more seasonable weather later this week, market sources said.
At the AECO storage hub, prices fell 10 cents to about C$1.80 per gigajoule (GJ) as heating demand weakened with milder forecasts in Alberta.
In response to the softer daily market, forward months also eased. May AECO gas traded at C$1.72 and C$1.73 per GJ, while May-October business was talked at C$1.65-1.67.
"The wild card will be storage. It will depend on how much gas goes into storage this weekend," one Calgary-based trader said.
At Sumas, Wash., prices slipped three cents to the mid-$1.40s per million British thermal units (mmBtu).
At Niagara, prices were mostly steady in the low-to-mid $2.30s per mmBtu. Warmer air is forecast to arrive by next week, which will likely put some downward pressure on prices.
